definition: to laugh away (instead of taking seriously)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: He is sophisticated enough to laugh things off and let bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 他成熟老练，对事一笑了之，既往不咎。

sentences.english: Jiangning explained that he just appreciate her naive, qian clouds laugh it off.
sentences.chinese: 江宁解释他只是欣赏她的天真才能，倩云一笑了之。

sentences.english: “I felt nauseous, ” she says. “I tried to laugh it off.
sentences.chinese: “我感到很恶心，”她说，“我试着一笑了之。

sentences.english: “I felt nauseous,” she says. “I tried to laugh it off.
sentences.chinese: “我感到很恶心，”她说，“我试着一笑了之。
他会不会只是一笑了之？

sentences.english: For those ignorant, laugh on the line.
sentences.chinese: 对于那些无知者，一笑了之就行了。

sentences.english: She only laughed at what I told her.
sentences.chinese: 对我告诉他的事，她只是一笑了之。

sentences.english: He passed off the accusation with a laugh.
At first, my team laughed and did not believe me.
sentences.chinese: 最开始，我的同事们一笑了之，不相信我说的。

definition: to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
to dismiss sth with a laugh (idiom)/to laugh it off
to handle the situation calmly (idiom)/unruffled/to treat the situation lightly
vicious slander/to calumny maliciously
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to play deaf-mute
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to take sth to heart/to take sth seriously
object of ridicule/laughingstock/to laugh over sth/to make light chat
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
to take a laissez-faire attitude
(of a defect etc) to be of no great matter (idiom)/harmless
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
